snippet: Political news from today's Times, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.
abstract: Political news from today's Times, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.
lead_paragraph: In Today's TimesThe campaign filings of "super PACs," the political groups that burst onto the scene after the Supreme Court's Citizens United decision in 2010, reveal an assortment of donors spending millions of dollars largely to support Republican candidates, most notably Mitt Romney, write Nicholas Confessore and Michael Luo. The filings also reveal the degree of secrecy that these PACs can offer to donors.
